intro: Brodiaea gracilis, commonly known as the slender brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to California and adjacent regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing white or pale pink blossoms. Brodiaea gracilis is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in open grasslands and rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for rock gardens and native plant collections.
